moves.1. e4 f5: The fred defence. Seem really stupid to play this but i have good result with. Of course there is a refutation but nowadays my oponents had never see it, ouf.
moves.2. Nc3 fxe4: ok you don't want my pawn, me yes.
moves.5. Bd3 g6: to avoid Qh5+ (chess) and the rook is lost and the king go to a journey.
moves.6. Nf3 Bg7: develop and try to little castle
moves.7. Qe2+ Kf7: ok no castle. No trouble it is often like this in the fred defence and the rook h is not closed.
moves.8. Bc4+ d5: do a free check is a strong tentation but not often the best idea.
moves.10. Qxc4+ Be6: the same (will I have the queen too)
moves.11. Qb4 Nc6: develop and attack the queen who want to walk around the board
moves.13. d3 Kg8: to evacuate the king because after Ng5 the pawn f can' move
moves.14. h3 Qd6: to decrease presure (not the best idea but cool for the brain)
moves.15. Qd2 Rad8: take the half open colunm d and look the white queen
moves.16. a3 Bd5: i had hesitate with Nd4 but I don't see the moves after this one. So i try to attack the Knight who help the white king and double pawns on g.
